# **Delivery of Strategic Planning Workshop and Support for Communities in the Development of Community Safety Plan (CSP)**

## **Notice Details**

- **Reference number:** cb-5002-19387569
- **Publication date:** 2023-04-24
- **Closing date:** 2023-05-15T14:00:00
- **Amendment number:** 4
- **Amendment date:** 2023-05-15
- **Solicitation number:** 202204867-B

## **Tender Description**

Public Safety Canada (PS) is seeking offers to provide strategic planning workshops and support for communities in the development of Community Safety Plan (CSP). The services will be delivered on an "as-and-when-required" basis for a period of five years, with an option to extend for an additional year.

The objective of the work is to support communities through the three stages of the CSP process: community building, action planning, and community mobilization. The facilitator will support the community through these stages by delivering the CSP process and providing coaching and mentoring services within and outside of workshop sessions.

The services will be required in various regions across Canada, including Nova Scotia, Prince Edward Island, New Brunswick, Newfoundland and Labrador, Ontario, Manitoba, Saskatchewan, Alberta, British Columbia, and Northern Canada.

## **Mandatory Requirement**

This procurement is set aside under the federal government's Mandatory Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business. Only responsive Indigenous Business offers will be reviewed, and ranked in ascending order with the highest combined evaluated price being recommended for the first ranked Standing Offer under each region.

## **Contracting Authority**

The Contracting Authority is Jessica Evans, Acting Sr. Acquisitions Advisor for Public Safety Canada.

## **Security Requirement**

There is no security requirement for this procurement.

## **Tender Documents and Attachments**

All necessary tender documents, including the Request for Standing Offer (RFSO) document, are available on the Canada Buys website. Optional Offeror Engagement Sessions will be held via Microsoft TEAMS on May 4th, 2023 at 1:30PM (EDT) for interested bidders.

## **Notice URL**

The notice URL is not provided in this version of the tender announcement.

## **Attachments**

The following attachments are provided with this notice:
- Request for Standing Offer (RFSO) document
- Bidders' Guide: Community Safety Planning
- Questions and Answers (Q&A) document
- Standing Offer (SO)
